oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Samuel Morgan
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Samuel Morgan (1798-1880) seated as a desk with legs crossed as he writes in a book. Samuel Morgan was known as the "Merchant Prince of Nashville." Samuel Morgan manufactured Confederate munitions and served as Chairman of the Central Bureau of Military Supplies in Nashville. Upon his death, Samuel Morgan was interred in the southeast corner of the Tennessee State Capitol.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Metro Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
